matchExpressions.description: A list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.

matchLabels.description: A map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels map is equivalent to an element of `match_expressions`, whose key field is "key", the operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.

key.description: The label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: A key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators ard `In`, `NotIn`, `Exists` and `DoesNotExist`.

values.description: An array of string values. If the operator is `In` or `NotIn`, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is `Exists` or `DoesNotExist`, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

jqPathExpressions.description: jq path to ignore differences

jsonPointers.description: Json pointers to ignore differences

rollingSyncs.description: Update strategy allowing you to group Applications by labels present on the generated Application resources. When the ApplicationSet changes, the changes will be applied to each group of Application resources sequentially.

steps.description: Configuration used to define which applications to include in each stage of the rolling sync. All Applications in each group must become Healthy before the ApplicationSet controller will proceed to update the next group of Applications.

matchExpressions.description: A list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.

maxUpdate.description: Maximum number of simultaneous Application updates in a group. Supports both integer and percentage string values (rounds down, but floored at 1 Application for >0%). Default is 100%, unbounded.

key.description: The label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: A key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators ard `In`, `NotIn`, `Exists` and `DoesNotExist`.

values.description: An array of string values. If the operator is `In` or `NotIn`, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is `Exists` or `DoesNotExist`, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

chart.description: Helm chart name. Must be specified for applications sourced from a Helm repo.

name.description: Name is used to refer to a source and is displayed in the UI. It is supported in multi-source Applications since version 2.14

path.description: Directory path within the repository. Only valid for applications sourced from Git.

ref.description: Reference to another `source` within defined sources. See associated documentation on [Helm value files from external Git repository](https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/multiple_sources/#helm-value-files-from-external-git-repository) regarding combining `ref` with `path` and/or `chart`.

repoUrl.description: URL to the repository (Git or Helm) that contains the application manifests.

targetRevision.description: Revision of the source to sync the application to. In case of Git, this can be commit, tag, or branch. If omitted, will equal to HEAD. In case of Helm, this is a semver tag for the Chart's version.

exclude.description: Glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly excluded from being used during manifest generation. This takes precedence over the `include` field. To match multiple patterns, wrap the patterns in {} and separate them with commas. For example: '{config.yaml,env-use2/*}'

include.description: Glob pattern to match paths against that should be explicitly included during manifest generation. If this field is set, only matching manifests will be included. To match multiple patterns, wrap the patterns in {} and separate them with commas. For example: '{*.yml,*.yaml}'

recurse.description: Whether to scan a directory recursively for manifests.

code.description: Determines whether the variable should be evaluated as jsonnet code or treated as string.
Determines whether the variable should be evaluated as jsonnet code or treated as string.

fileParameters.description: File parameters for the helm template.

ignoreMissingValueFiles.description: Prevents 'helm template' from failing when `value_files` do not exist locally by not appending them to 'helm template --values'.

parameters.description: Helm parameters which are passed to the helm template command upon manifest generation.

passCredentials.description: If true then adds '--pass-credentials' to Helm commands to pass credentials to all domains.

releaseName.description: Helm release name. If omitted it will use the application name.

skipCrds.description: Whether to skip custom resource definition installation step (Helm's [--skip-crds](https://helm.sh/docs/chart_best_practices/custom_resource_definitions/)).

valueFiles.description: List of Helm value files to use when generating a template.

values.description: Helm values to be passed to 'helm template', typically defined as a block.

version.description: The Helm version to use for templating. Accepts either `v2` or `v3`

path.description: Path to the file containing the values for the Helm parameter.

forceString.description: Determines whether to tell Helm to interpret booleans and numbers as strings.

commonAnnotations.description: List of additional annotations to add to rendered manifests.

commonLabels.description: List of additional labels to add to rendered manifests.

images.description: List of Kustomize image override specifications.

namePrefix.description: Prefix appended to resources for Kustomize apps.

nameSuffix.description: Suffix appended to resources for Kustomize apps.

version.description: Version of Kustomize to use for rendering manifests.

path.description: Path to a file containing the patch to apply.

annotationSelector.description: Annotation selector to use when matching the Kubernetes resource.

group.description: The Kubernetes resource Group to match for.

kind.description: The Kubernetes resource Kind to match for.

labelSelector.description: Label selector to use when matching the Kubernetes resource.

namespace.description: The Kubernetes resource Namespace to match for.

version.description: The Kubernetes resource Version to match for.

envs.description: Environment variables passed to the plugin.

name.description: Name of the plugin. Only set the plugin name if the plugin is defined in `argocd-cm`. If the plugin is defined as a sidecar, omit the name. The plugin will be automatically matched with the Application according to the plugin's discovery rules.

automated.description: Whether to automatically keep an application synced to the target revision.

managedNamespaceMetadata.description: Controls metadata in the given namespace (if `CreateNamespace=true`).

syncOptions.description: List of sync options. More info: https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/sync-options/.

allowEmpty.description: Allows apps have zero live resources.

prune.description: Whether to delete resources from the cluster that are not found in the sources anymore as part of automated sync.

selfHeal.description: Whether to revert resources back to their desired state upon modification in the cluster.

annotations.description: Annotations to apply to the namespace.

labels.description: Labels to apply to the namespace.

backoff.description: Controls how to backoff on subsequent retries of failed syncs.

limit.description: Maximum number of attempts for retrying a failed sync. If set to 0, no retries will be performed.

duration.description: Duration is the amount to back off. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

factor.description: Factor to multiply the base duration after each failed retry.

maxDuration.description: Maximum amount of time allowed for the backoff strategy. Default unit is seconds, but could also be a duration (e.g. `2m`, `1h`), as a string.

destination.description: Reference to the Kubernetes server and namespace in which the application will be deployed.

ignoreDifferences.description: Resources and their fields which should be ignored during comparison. More info: https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/diffing/#application-level-configuration.

infos.description: List of information (URLs, email addresses, and plain text) that relates to the application.

project.description: The project the application belongs to. Defaults to `default`.

revisionHistoryLimit.description: Limits the number of items kept in the application's revision history, which is used for informational purposes as well as for rollbacks to previous versions. This should only be changed in exceptional circumstances. Setting to zero will store no history. This will reduce storage used. Increasing will increase the space used to store the history, so we do not recommend increasing it. Default is 10.

sources.description: Location of the application's manifests or chart.

syncPolicy.description: Controls when and how a sync will be performed.

name.description: Name of the target cluster. Can be used instead of `server`.

namespace.description: Target namespace for the application's resources. The namespace will only be set for namespace-scoped resources that have not set a value for .metadata.namespace.

server.description: URL of the target cluster and must be set to the Kubernetes control plane API.

group.description: The Kubernetes resource Group to match for.

jqPathExpressions.description: List of JQ path expression strings targeting the field(s) to ignore.

jsonPointers.description: List of JSONPaths strings targeting the field(s) to ignore.

kind.description: The Kubernetes resource Kind to match for.

managedFieldsManagers.description: List of external controller manager names whose changes to fields should be ignored.

hook.description: Indicates whether or not this resource has a hook annotation.

namespace.description: The Kubernetes resource Namespace.

requiresPruning.description: Indicates if the resources requires pruning or not.

images.description: All images of application child resources.

revision.description: Information about the revision the comparison has been performed to.

revisions.description: Information about the revision(s) the comparison has been performed to.

bearerToken.description: Server requires Bearer authentication. The client will not attempt to use refresh tokens for an OAuth2 flow.

execProviderConfig.description: Configuration for an exec provider used to call an external command to perform cluster authentication See: https://godoc.org/k8s.io/client-go/tools/clientcmd/api#ExecConfig.

password.description: Password for servers that require Basic authentication.

tlsClientConfig.description: Settings to enable transport layer security when connecting to the cluster.

username.description: Username for servers that require Basic authentication.

roleArn.description: IAM role ARN. If set then AWS IAM Authenticator assume a role to perform cluster operations instead of the default AWS credential provider chain.

apiVersion.description: Preferred input version of the ExecInfo

args.description: Arguments to pass to the command when executing it

env.description: Env defines additional environment variables to expose to the process. Passed as a map of strings

installHint.description: This text is shown to the user when the executable doesn't seem to be present

caData.description: PEM-encoded bytes (typically read from a root certificates bundle).

certData.description: PEM-encoded bytes (typically read from a client certificate file).

insecure.description: Whether server should be accessed without verifying the TLS certificate.

keyData.description: PEM-encoded bytes (typically read from a client certificate key file).

serverName.description: Name to pass to the server for SNI and used in the client to check server certificates against. If empty, the hostname used to contact the server is used.

applicationsCount.description: Number of applications managed by Argo CD on the cluster.

connectionStates.description: Information about the connection to the cluster.

message.description: Human readable information about the connection status.

status.description: Current status indicator for the connection.

annotations.description: An unstructured key value map stored with the cluster secret that may be used to store arbitrary metadata. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/annotations

labels.description: Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) the cluster secret. May match selectors of replication controllers and services. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/labels

clientCertificate.description: PEM-encoded client certificate for TLS authentication. Can be sourced from `KUBE_CLIENT_CERT_DATA`.

clientKey.description: PEM-encoded client certificate key for TLS authentication. Can be sourced from `KUBE_CLIENT_KEY_DATA`.

clusterCaCertificate.description: PEM-encoded root certificates bundle for TLS authentication. Can be sourced from `KUBE_CLUSTER_CA_CERT_DATA`.

configContext.description: Context to choose from the config file. Can be sourced from `KUBE_CTX`.

exec.description: Configuration block to use an [exec-based credential plugin](https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/access-authn-authz/authentication/#client-go-credential-plugins), e.g. call an external command to receive user credentials.

host.description: The hostname (in form of URI) of the Kubernetes API. Can be sourced from `KUBE_HOST`.

insecure.description: Whether server should be accessed without verifying the TLS certificate. Can be sourced from `KUBE_INSECURE`.

password.description: The password to use for HTTP basic authentication when accessing the Kubernetes API. Can be sourced from `KUBE_PASSWORD`.

token.description: Token to authenticate an service account. Can be sourced from `KUBE_TOKEN`.

username.description: The username to use for HTTP basic authentication when accessing the Kubernetes API. Can be sourced from `KUBE_USER`.

apiVersion.description: API version to use when decoding the ExecCredentials resource, e.g. `client.authentication.k8s.io/v1beta1`.

args.description: Map of environment variables to set when executing the plugin.

env.description: List of arguments to pass when executing the plugin.

provider.description:
The provider type for the argocd package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

authToken.description: ArgoCD authentication token, takes precedence over `username`/`password`. Can be set through the `ARGOCD_AUTH_TOKEN` environment variable.

certFile.description: Additional root CA certificates file to add to the client TLS connection pool.

configPath.description: Override the default config path of `$HOME/.config/argocd/config`. Only relevant when `use_local_config`. Can be set through the `ARGOCD_CONFIG_PATH` environment variable.

context.description: Context to choose when using a local ArgoCD config file. Only relevant when `use_local_config`. Can be set through `ARGOCD_CONTEXT` environment variable.

core.description: Configure direct access using Kubernetes API server. **Warning**: this feature works by starting a local ArgoCD API server that talks directly to the Kubernetes API using the **current context in the default kubeconfig** (`~/.kube/config`). This behavior cannot be overridden using either environment variables or the `kubernetes` block in the provider configuration at present). If the server fails to start (e.g. your kubeconfig is misconfigured) then the provider will fail as a result of the `argocd` module forcing it to exit and no logs will be available to help you debug this. The error message will be similar to > `The plugin encountered an error, and failed to respond to the plugin.(*GRPCProvider).ReadResource call. The plugin logs may contain more details.` To debug this, you will need to login via the ArgoCD CLI using `argocd login --core` and then running an operation. E.g. `argocd app list`.

grpcWeb.description: Whether to use gRPC web proxy client. Useful if Argo CD server is behind proxy which does not support HTTP2.

grpcWebRootPath.description: Use the gRPC web proxy client and set the web root, e.g. `argo-cd`. Useful if the Argo CD server is behind a proxy at a non-root path.

headers.description: Additional headers to add to each request to the ArgoCD server.

insecure.description: Whether to skip TLS server certificate. Can be set through the `ARGOCD_INSECURE` environment variable.

kubernetes.description: Kubernetes configuration overrides. Only relevant when `port_forward = true` or `port_forward_with_namespace = "foo"`. The kubeconfig file that is used can be overridden using the [`KUBECONFIG` environment variable](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/organize-cluster-access-kubeconfig/#the-kubeconfig-environment-variable)).

password.description: Authentication password. Can be set through the `ARGOCD_AUTH_PASSWORD` environment variable.

plainText.description: Whether to initiate an unencrypted connection to ArgoCD server.

portForward.description: Connect to a random argocd-server port using port forwarding.

portForwardWithNamespace.description: Namespace name which should be used for port forwarding.

serverAddr.description: ArgoCD server address with port. Can be set through the `ARGOCD_SERVER` environment variable.

useLocalConfig.description: Use the authentication settings found in the local config file. Useful when you have previously logged in using SSO. Conflicts with `auth_token`, `username` and `password`.

username.description: Authentication username. Can be set through the `ARGOCD_AUTH_USERNAME` environment variable.

authToken.description: ArgoCD authentication token, takes precedence over `username`/`password`. Can be set through the `ARGOCD_AUTH_TOKEN` environment variable.

context.description: Context to choose when using a local ArgoCD config file. Only relevant when `use_local_config`. Can be set through `ARGOCD_CONTEXT` environment variable.

account.description: Account name. Defaults to the current account. I.e. the account configured on the `provider` block.

expiresAt.description: If `expires_in` is set, Unix timestamp upon which the token will expire.

expiresIn.description: Duration before the token will expire. Valid time units are `ns`, `us` (or `s`), `ms`, `s`, `m`, `h`. E.g. `12h`, `7d`. Default: No expiration.

issuedAt.description: Unix timestamp at which the token was issued.

renewAfter.description: Duration to control token silent regeneration based on token age. Valid time units are `ns`, `us` (or `s`), `ms`, `s`, `m`, `h`. If set, then the token will be regenerated if it is older than `renew_after`. I.e. if `currentDate - issued_at > renew_after`.

renewBefore.description: Duration to control token silent regeneration based on remaining token lifetime. If `expires_in` is set, Pulumi will regenerate the token if `expires_at - currentDate < renew_before`. Valid time units are `ns`, `us` (or `s`), `ms`, `s`, `m`, `h`.

cascade.description: Whether to applying cascading deletion when application is removed.

metadata.description: Standard Kubernetes object metadata. For more info see the [Kubernetes reference](https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata).

statuses.description: Status information for the application. **Note**: this is not guaranteed to be up to date immediately after creating/updating an application unless `wait=true`.

validate.description: Whether to validate the application spec before creating or updating the application.

wait.description: Upon application creation or update, wait for application health/sync status to be healthy/Synced, upon application deletion, wait for application to be removed, when set to true. Wait timeouts are controlled by the provider Create, Update and Delete resource timeouts (all default to 5 minutes). **Note**: if ArgoCD decides not to sync an application (e.g. because the project to which the application belongs has a `sync_window` applied) then you will experience an expected timeout event if `wait = true`.

metadatas.description: Standard cluster secret's metadata. More info: https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata

name.description: Name of the cluster. If omitted, will use the server address.

namespaces.description: List of namespaces which are accessible in that cluster. Cluster level resources would be ignored if namespace list is not empty.

project.description: Reference between project and cluster that allow you automatically to be added as item inside Destinations project entity. More info: https://argo-cd.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user-guide/projects/#project-scoped-repositories-and-clusters.

server.description: Server is the API server URL of the Kubernetes cluster.

shard.description: Optional shard number. Calculated on the fly by the application controller if not specified.

config.description: Cluster information for connecting to a cluster.

metadatas.description: Standard cluster secret's metadata. More info: https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata

name.description: Name of the cluster. If omitted, will use the server address.

namespaces.description: List of namespaces which are accessible in that cluster. Cluster level resources would be ignored if namespace list is not empty.
